page.title: 04HOUSING
page.content: Apart from the two other villages the rest of the housing pattern consists of widely scattered farms. Cliburn is built around the cross roads of the Penrith_Bolton and Morland_T.Sowerby roads.It is a small neat village of red sandstone houses with slate roofs.There are several village farms three of which are working farms.Interspaced between are conversions of barns,chapels etc.with a few modern bungalows. Gt.Strickland in the block is the start of a long straggling ribbon village of older limestone/sandstone buildings with modern ones between them. The farms are either on the roadside or joined to it by tracks.They consist of a wide range of buildings but most were built at the start of the Enclosure about 1700.
